page.title: 06LEISURE - WENSLEYDALE
page.content: Until recently very few local people could afford the time or the money to go away on holiday. One farmer told us that he had never had a holiday until 1980; now he goes abroad once a year. Most families take a holiday away each year. A few go away for days to visit a place of interest or to the sea-side at Morecambe, Scarborough or Redcar. As well as village fetes and functions in the Village Halls, there are clubs and societies available to almost all age groups. There are evening classes during the winter months. To attend the various clubs and classes, people often have to travel to other villages, and sharing cars is normal. The public houses are local gathering places, especially for young adults. Young farmers groups are very well-supported and traditional games such as quoits are popular in villages
